intro: Argemone pleiacantha subsp. pleiacantha, commonly known as the Mexican prickly poppy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and spiny, lobed leaves. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its capsule fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for its unique appearance.
